Anonymous Sources.Sourced Statement: After a series of reasonably amicable negotiations, the co-founders of Anthropic were able to negotiate their exit on mutually agreeable terms.
Anonymous Sources.Source Justification: According to three people familiar with the attempt to push Mr. Altman out.

Anonymous Sources.Sourced Statement: There was no attempt to ‘oust’ Sam Altman at the time the founders of Anthropic left OpenAI.
Anonymous Sources.Source Justification: According to an Anthropic spokeswoman, Sally Aldous, in a second statement.

Anonymous Sources.Sourced Statement: Senior OpenAI leaders, including Mr. Sutskever, later discussed whether Ms. Toner should be removed.
Anonymous Sources.Source Justification: According to a person involved in the conversations.

Anonymous Sources.Sourced Statement: But shortly after those discussions, Mr. Sutskever did the unexpected: He sided with board members to oust Mr. Altman.
Anonymous Sources.Source Justification: According to two people familiar with the board’s deliberations.

Anonymous Sources.Sourced Statement: Hours after Mr. Altman was ousted, OpenAI executives confronted the remaining board members during a video call.
Anonymous Sources.Source Justification: According to three people who were on the call.

Anonymous Sources.Sourced Statement: On Sunday, Mr. Sutskever was urged at OpenAI’s office to reverse course by Mr. Brockman’s wife, Anna.
Anonymous Sources.Source Justification: According to two people familiar with the exchange.

Unnamed Group of People.Sourced Statement: Nearly all of OpenAI’s 800 employees had threatened to follow Mr. Altman to Microsoft.
Unnamed Group of People.Source Justification: Their loyalty to Mr. Altman and potential impact on the company’s future.

Document Sources.Sourced Statement: According to an email that Mr. Altman wrote to colleagues and that was viewed by The New York Times.
Document Sources.Source Justification: The email was viewed by The New York Times, providing direct insight into Mr. Altman’s concerns.

Document Sources.Sourced Statement: The company said on its website that each director’s fiduciary duty would be to “humanity, not OpenAI investors”.
Document Sources.Source Justification: The company’s official statement on its website, outlining its mission and values.
